text: If we customize the form embed code, the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options|legacy documentation> is gives callbacks that take jQuery form objects. I thought HubSpot removed jQuery from forms?

<@U02HX1H0YS1> you might try adding a MutationObserver to the parent container of the chat script, then once `HubSpot-messages-loader` has loaded fire `getScriptEnvParms()`

a better idea might be a top-level await, so this code can be evaluated before use in parent modules, without blocking siblings from loading

jQuery itself is indeed removed from HubSpot forms.

This is just an event handler, you donâ€™t need jQuery itself to trigger the event.
IIRC you can basically do this: <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/change_event>
